text: Thank you everyone My name is Omotari Adelike I'm a software developer and a cloud devops enthusiast About a few weeks not weeks a month ago one of our clusters crashed And ten minutes before then everything was alright The grafana dashboards were green the prometheus metrics were alright And then all of a sudden everything crashed So that got me What if our observability stack could actually see this coming and prevent it from So in this talk I'll be breezing through our AI apps communicating to kubernetes and seeing incidents before they happen and preventing them So currently what we have right now we have our traditional systems wait for incidents to happen before reacting And with AI AI kind of flips the model because with AI we can predict what could happen correctly and then prevent it from happening So I'm pretty sure somebody is asking what does a road got to do with any of this So the point is that what we currently have I imagine it to be like you're driving and then when an incident happens you're looking at the rearview mirror in order to do something in order to react But with AI we're looking forward and anything that pops up on the road we see it and we're able to find our way through So how does AI fit into all this Probitius gives us the metrics Grafana gives us the visualization we could visualize everything that is happening in our system with Grafana But with AI it supports the anomalies in our systems and then it helps us with predictive scaling and then it actually helps us do other stuff too And reward impact of AI Teams are already using ML models to forecast CPU spikes as you already see AI is helping teams detect noisy neighbors in multi tenant clusters It's preventing it's predicting for evictions even before they happen So there's a whole lot of good that AI we've been enjoying with AI in our Kubernetes clusters So we all have stories of our frustrations with AI and it isn't magic That's the thing it isn't magic AI is as good as data This is also to remind us that it's just like our critical infrastructures it requires good data and it also requires constant monitoring So you can't just wave AI in front of your problems like a magic wand and then it all disappears No But the implication of this is that false positives could occur and when this happens this could lead to alerts this could lead to alert deluge this could lead to stress because of constant notifications that we do not even need So in order to fix this all we need to do to remedy this is to monitor machine learning alert rates and adjust the sensitivity So basically start small validate the inputs and we're not putting up with humans definitely humans are part of the process So as AI suggests we have humans on the team that are cross checking the result of this So what's the future Imagine clusters that predict failures and then self heal This is the future This is not science fiction It's already imagined in both academics research and industry research and in early production So you don't have to start with something expansive Just start small It could be that you train a small anomaly model of your premature data to test measure and as you do all this you're learning something The idea is to build confidence AI just like any other autonomous tool is to help us build confidence So as we start small we build confidence and this will help us for mass adoption So this my friend is how we move from firefighting at 3am to resilience Thank you Thank you
